skill.name: omero-integration
skill.description: Microscopy data management platform. Access images via Python, retrieve datasets, analyze pixels, manage ROIs/annotations, batch processing, for high-content screening and microscopy workflows.

skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No data theft, exfiltration, or malicious execution patterns detected. Content consists of documentation and example code for OMERO usage.

content.user_title: Manage OMERO microscopy data with Python
content.value_statement: You need a reliable way to access and organize microscopy images and metadata. This skill guides you through OMERO Python workflows for data access, analysis, and annotation.
actual_capabilities: Connect to OMERO servers and manage sessions
Navigate projects, datasets, images, and screening data
Read pixel data and adjust rendering settings
Create and manage ROIs and ROI measurements
Attach annotations, tags, and file results
Store and query analysis results in OMERO tables
limitations: Requires access to an OMERO server and valid credentials
Examples assume Python and the omero-py package
Does not include a GUI workflow
Advanced server administration is out of scope

use_cases.title: Batch analyze microscopy data
use_cases.description: Extract pixel data and store measurements in tables for large datasets.

use_cases.title: Organize annotations at scale
use_cases.description: Apply tags, map metadata, and attach files across projects.

use_cases.title: Automate server-side processing
use_cases.description: Build OMERO scripts for repeatable batch workflows.

prompt_templates.title: Connect and list projects
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a minimal Python example to connect to OMERO and list all projects, using a context manager.

prompt_templates.title: Retrieve dataset images
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide code to load a dataset by ID and print image names and IDs.

prompt_templates.title: Create and measure ROI
prompt_templates.prompt: Give a Python example to create a rectangular ROI on an image and compute mean intensity.

prompt_templates.title: Store results in a table
prompt_templates.prompt: Write an example that creates an OMERO table with image ID and mean intensity columns and links it to a dataset.

output_examples.input: Summarize a workflow to analyze all images in a dataset and save results in OMERO tables.
output: Connect to the server using BlitzGateway
Load the target dataset and iterate its images
Compute per image statistics from pixel data
Create an OMERO table with result columns
Link the table file to the dataset

best_practices: Use context managers to close connections cleanly
Store structured results in tables or map annotations
Use namespaces to keep metadata organized

faq.question: Is this compatible with my OMERO version?
faq.answer: It targets standard OMERO Python API usage. Check your server version and omero-py compatibility.

faq.question: What are the limits for large datasets?
faq.answer: Performance depends on server resources. Use batch workflows and avoid loading full planes unnecessarily.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with existing pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. The examples are modular and can be embedded in scripts or analysis pipelines.

faq.question: Does it access my local files or secrets?
faq.answer: No. It describes OMERO usage and does not include data exfiltration or hidden access patterns.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot connection errors?
faq.answer: Verify host, port, credentials, and network access. Check OMERO server logs if needed.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual OMERO clients?
faq.answer: This focuses on automation and reproducible scripts rather than interactive GUI workflows.
